content: I want to define the map Ordinal.toENat, which preserves addition, multiplication, and order. Unfortunately, the ordinals don't have commutative addition, which means they're not a semiring, which means I can't declare this as an Ordinal →+*o ENat.
Would it make sense to weaken the assumptions in docs#OrderRingHom ?
Specifically, extending docs#RingOrderHom to MulZeroOneClass + AddZeroClass seems both sensible and more than general enough for what I'm doing
I think we should experiment to remove all algebra axioms from the definition of morphisms, and only assume the data of +, etc
I like that idea, I'll try and test this out
Note that [MulZeroOneClass R] [AddZeroClass R] will create two unrelated projections to Zero R.
Ah, well that's another argument to just not assume any algebraic axioms
I'm getting a lot of quite cryptic error messages, though. I might not be qualified to be tampering with the algebraic hierarchy like this.
Might be worth starting small, I'll just refactor MonoidHom and AddMonoidHom to begin with
